thread.title: Jiangsu Suning and Beijing Guoan 'rule themselves out of signing Manchester United's Wayne Rooney'
thread.title_full: Jiangsu Suning and Beijing Guoan 'rule themselves out of signing Manchester United's Wayne Rooney'

author: Liam Corless
title: Jiangsu Suning and Beijing Guoan 'rule themselves out of signing Manchester United's Wayne Rooney'
text:
Sport Jiangsu Suning and Beijing Guoan 'rule themselves out of signing Manchester United's Wayne Rooney' Of the other clubs left for Rooney to join in China, only Tianjin Quanjian have a spare space in their squad and the financial might to lure the England skipper to the Far East Share Wayne Rooney appears to be running out of options in China (Photo: Clive Mason) Share Get Manchester United FC updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Jiangsu Suning and Beijing Guoan have reportedly ruled themselves out of the race to sign Wayne Rooney from Manchester United. 
Rooney's agent Paul Stretford is currently in China trying to engineer his client a lucrative move to the Chinese Super League. 
However, the BBC say two of the biggest clubs in the country, Jiansu Suning and Beijing Guoan, are not interested in acquiring Rooney's services. 
That leaves just five available clubs with a spare foreign player spot - and four of those, Changchun Yatai, Chongqing Lifan, Guizhou R&F and Henan Jianye, realistically don't have the financial might to sign the England captain. 
Chinese Super League rules dictate that clubs can only have five foreign players in their squad, at least one of whom must be from another Asian country, which rules out nine of the remaining 16 teams in the division from snapping up Rooney. Jiangsu Suning and Beijing Guoan have reportedly ruled themselves out of the race to sign Rooney (Photo: Getty) Video Loading Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now
